result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel E Plasky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber is granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
May serve electronic monitor after serving 30 days, and upon approval with the assessment and Sheriff's Department.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and Maintain full time employment.
Court will find Defendant eligible for expungement if Defendant successfully completes probation and shows proper attitude and with the agent's recommendation.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Participate with other counseling as recommended by the agent.
AODA and comply with treatment recommendation

Pay costs and DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel E Plasky in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:40 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreeement. Defendant is pleading to Count 1. Atty Cousins states plea agreement.

Atty Barkley concurs.

Defendant concurs.  

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Barkley for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Court takes a moment to re-review the criminal complaint.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Disorderly Conduct

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Victim is not present.

Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court finds the plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for a period of 60 Days, Imposed and Stayed
1 Day Jail Credit
Huber is granted for work, counseling and any other reason the Sheriff will allow.
May serve electronic monitor after serving 30 days, and upon approval with the assessment and Sheriff's Department
Probation for a period of 12 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
AODA and comply with treatment recommendation
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Obtain and Maintain full time employment
Participate with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Court will find Defendant eligible for expungement if Defendant successfully completes probation and shows proper attitude and with the agent's recommendation.

Current: 1213 Torun Road, Stevens Point, WI 54482 United States  (Effective: 07-20-2015)
Prior: 1213 Torren Road, Stevens Point, WI 54481
for Attorney to Appear and Act

2:47 p.m. Defendant Joel E Plasky in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.
Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
P/NG entered.
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 
Bond continued.


  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Prior: 1102 Fourth Ave, Stevens Point, WI 54481
James Plasky consents to contact with Joel Plasky.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.
***05-11-15: Letter from James Plasky consents to contact with Joel Plasky.

ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant(d.o.b. 06-30-1992) appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Disorderly Conduct.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a $1,000 signature bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  5/26/15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
